Technique: SCULPTURED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB; WOVEN
Name: Wooden stick shabti
Description: A small but finely carved wooden 'stick' shabti, wrapped in a single length of linen bandage. The facial features and wig are modelled. All over the figure is a written inscription in vertical lines. Such shabtis came from Dira' abu el-Naga and were dedicated by relatives of the deceased (see number 18.12.10.5).
